content.raw:
I'm able to reproduce the failure by clearing GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH and deleting `~/.gazebo/models/pr2` and invoking the test without an invalid DISPLAY (not sure if this is necessary, but it speeds up the loading process, which may play a factor in the race condition). When running the test, I saw the ModelDatabase download message, then I saw the `Speed: Empty[0.994117] Loaded[0.994251] Ratio[1.00013]` message indicating that the test had finished.

[Looking at the test](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/c5b1d48b8aeebf7e1ae801ef7542ec75312088d0/test/integration/speed_pr2.cc?at=default#cl-44), it appears that the pr2 model is spawned using [ServerFixture::SpawnModel](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/c5b1d48b8aeebf7e1ae801ef7542ec75312088d0/test/ServerFixture.hh?at=default#cl-1203), which publishes a message, but does not block. The test then waits for 2 seconds and continues. The test can probably be fixed by waiting for the model to exist, but we also should take a look at the SensorManager because there are probably some problems there too.
~~~
$ export GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH=""
$ export DISPLAY=asdf
$ rm -rf ~/.gazebo/models/pr2
$ gdb test/integration/INTEGRATION_speed_pr2
...
(gdb) r
...
[ RUN      ] PhysicsEngines/SpeedPR2Test.PR2World/0
[New Thread 0x7fffd791c700 (LWP 18021)]
[New Thread 0x7fffd711b700 (LWP 18022)]
[New Thread 0x7fffd691a700 (LWP 18023)]

[New Thread 0x7fffd4f93700 (LWP 18024)]

xcb_connection_has_error() returned true

...

Speed: Empty[0.994117] Loaded[0.994251] Ratio[1.00013]

...
[Thread 0x7fffd691a700 (LWP 18023) exited]

content.html:
I'm able to reproduce the failure by clearing GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH and deleting ~/.gazebo/models/pr2 and invoking the test without an invalid DISPLAY (not sure if this is necessary, but it speeds up the loading process, which may play a factor in the race condition). When running the test, I saw the ModelDatabase download message, then I saw the Speed: Empty[0.994117] Loaded[0.994251] Ratio[1.00013] message indicating that the test had finished.

Looking at the test, it appears that the pr2 model is spawned using ServerFixture::SpawnModel, which publishes a message, but does not block. The test then waits for 2 seconds and continues. The test can probably be fixed by waiting for the model to exist, but we also should take a look at the SensorManager because there are probably some problems there too.

$ export GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH=""
$ export DISPLAY=asdf
$ rm -rf ~/.gazebo/models/pr2
$ gdb test/integration/INTEGRATION_speed_pr2
...
